newsitem.title: USA: Input/Output sees Q2 earns below expectation.
newsitem.headline: Input/Output sees Q2 earns below expectation.

text.p: Input/Output Inc said on Wednesday it projected its second quarter earnings and revenues would be below expectations, due to unanticipated delays in concluding talks about equipment sales.
The company said net revenues should be in the range of $62 million to $67 million, with net earnings between $3 to $5 million, or $0.08 to $0.12 per share.

The First Call consensus earnings estimate for the second quarter was $0.28 per share. The company reported revenues of $70.5 million and net earnings of $8.1 million, or $0.21 per share in the same quarter last year.
Given the disruption in second quarter results, the Input/Output said it did not think current year-end estimates were achievable.
The First Call consensus earnings estimate for fiscal 1997 was $1.22 per share.
"Clearly, we are dissatisfied with these results," President and Chief Executive Officer Gary Owens said.
